company: The Rector & Visitors of the University of Virginia
job: Social Contagion in Human Systems Postdoctoral Research Associate
description:
The Network Systems Science & Advanced Computing (NSSAC) Division of the Biocomplexity Institute at the University of Virginia is seeking motivated, enthusiastic, self-driven candidates for a Postdoctoral Research Associate position. The Research Associate will join the Contagion Science and Technology Program, a prestigious new strategic research initiative funded by the University of Virginia through its Prominence-to-Preeminence STEM Targeted Initiatives Fund. The Biocomplexity Institute serves as the program’s organizing unit through a broad and comprehensive partnership with the University of Virginia Schools of Engineering and Applied Science, Data Science, Medicine, and the College of Arts & Sciences.
The incumbent will have a unique opportunity to explore the application of computing and data sciences at the interface of computational modeling and social sciences. Co-mentorship by experienced principal investigators from the College and Graduate School of Arts and Sciences and the Biocomplexity Institute will provide unique interdisciplinary working and learning environments.
The new Contagion Science team member will contribute to the creation and promulgation of a research roadmap that leverages new and existing theoretical frameworks, engineering techniques, and data science tools. The modeling at single or multiple levels of scale of individual behaviors and interactions will provide the technical and theoretical basis to better address the interconnected nature of contagious phenomena. The ideas developed as a part of this program are expected to support the development of theories for understanding large-scale networked complex systems. Strong candidates will have research interests in use cases such as epidemics and pandemics; social epidemiology; diffusion/containment of behaviors/information in large social networks; public health policy; modeling and simulations; and/or interdisciplinary science.
Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to: participating in unique learning and professional development experiences including the creation of themes for the research roadmap; leading the organization of workshops and other program relevant meetings; and supporting the collaboration of existing and potential program partners such as government agencies, industries, and researchers. This collective exposure allows the Postdoctoral Research Associate to gain experience in effective engagement and project management with the research community.
To learn more about NSSAC, the Biocomplexity Institute, and the Contagion Science Program visit: https://biocomplexity.virginia.edu/nssac and https://contagion-science.virginia.edu/

company: The Rector & Visitors of the University of Virginia
job: Computer Science and Systems Modeling Postdoctoral Research Associate
description:
The Network Systems Science & Advanced Computing (NSSAC) Division of the Biocomplexity Institute at the University of Virginia is seeking motivated, enthusiastic, self-driven candidates for a Postdoctoral Research Associate position. The associate will join the Contagion Science and Technology Program, a prestigious new strategic research initiative funded by the University of Virginia through its Prominence-to-Preeminence STEM Targeted Initiatives Fund. The Institute serves as the program’s organizing unit with a broad and comprehensive partnership of the University of Virginia Schools of Engineering and Applied Science, Data Science, Medicine, and the College of Arts & Sciences.
The incumbent will have a unique opportunity to explore applications of computing and data sciences at the interface(s) of network systems modeling, computer science and engineering, multidisciplinary data science and/or machine learning or graph modeling and mining. Co-mentorship by experienced principal investigators from the School of Data Science, the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences, and the Biocomplexity Institute will provide unique interdisciplinary work- and learning environments.
The new Contagion Science team member will contribute to the creation and promulgation of a research roadmap that leverages new and existing theoretical frameworks, engineering techniques and data science tools for the modeling of individual components and their interactions to address the interconnected nature of contagious phenomena. Furthermore, the ideas developed as a part of this program will lead to new general theories for understanding large-scale networked complex systems. The successful candidate is expected to publish basic and applied research results in the flagship conferences and journals at the confluence of these areas, and to seek and pursue new funding and teaming opportunities.
Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to: participating in unique learning and professional development experiences including the creation of themes for the research roadmap; leading organization of workshops and other program relevant meetings; and, helping to coordinate the collaboration of existing and potential program partners such as, government agencies, industries, and multidisciplinary researchers. This collective exposure allows Postdoctoral Research Associate to gain experience in effective engagement and project management with the research community and to focus on advancing research programs and computing.
To learn more about NSSAC, the Biocomplexity Institute, and the Contagion Science Program visit: https://biocomplexity.virginia.edu/nssac and https://contagion-science.virginia.edu/
The UVA Biocomplexity Institute is located in the UVA Discovery Park at 994 Research Park Boulevard, Charlottesville, VA. Depending on the needs of the group, or as deemed by the team manager, team members may be required to work periodically in open offices, meeting rooms or other shared workspaces.
Required Qualifications:
PhD in any of the following fields or specializations: Network systems modeling, computer science, engineering, multidisciplinary data science and/or machine learning, graph modeling and mining
Similar or related fields will also be considered, however programming fluency is required. The selected candidate must hold a PhD at the time of appointment
A strong track record of publications in selective conferences and/or journals
Preferred Qualifications:
